CoverageDescription.ows:Title: Near-Real Time Surface Ocean Velocity
CoverageDescription.ows:Abstract: CoverageDescription generated by OPeNDAP WCS UseCase 2.0

Field.ows:Title: surface_eastward_sea_water_velocity
Field.ows:Abstract: Eastward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector.

Field.ows:Title: surface_northward_sea_water_velocity
Field.ows:Abstract: Northward component of a 2D sea surface velocity vector.

Field.ows:Title: longitudinal dilution of precision
Field.ows:Abstract: The longitudinal dilution of precision (DOPx) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the eastward velocity estimate (u). DOPx is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the eastward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.

Field.ows:Title: latitudinal dilution of precision
Field.ows:Abstract: The latitudinal dilution of precision (DOPy) represents the\\012contribution of the radars' configuration geometry to\\012uncertainty in the northward velocity estimate (v). DOPy is a\\012direct multiplier of the standard error in obtaining the\\012standard deviation for the northward velocity estimate from the\\012least squares best fit. DOPx and DOPy are commonly used to\\012obtain the geometric dilution of precision\\012(GDOP = sqrt(DOPx^2 + DOPy^2)), a useful metric for filtering\\012errant velocities due to poor geometry.
